qas.question: In which mountain cave did Mohammad experience his first revelation?
Where did Mohammad move to found a separate Muslim community?
Prisoners from which battle are thought to have helped Muslims learn to write?
Vegetation from which tree served as an early recording medium for the Quran?
When Muhammad dies, what had not yet been compiled as a book?
In which mountain cave did Mohammad experience his last revelation?
Where didn't Mohammad move to find a separate Muslim community?
Prisoners from which battle are thought to have helped Muslims learn to sing?
Vegetation from which tree served as an later recording medium for the Quran?
When Muhammad dies, what had been compiled as a book?

context: Islamic tradition relates that Muhammad received his first revelation in the <a0_0><b5_0>Cave of Hira<b5_0/><a0_0/> during one of his isolated retreats to the mountains. Thereafter, he received revelations over a period of 23 years. According to hadith and Muslim history, after Muhammad immigrated to <a1_0><b6_0>Medina<b6_0/><a1_0/> and formed an independent Muslim community, he ordered many of his companions to recite the Quran and to learn and teach the laws, which were revealed daily. It is related that some of the Quraysh who were taken prisoners at the battle of <a2_0><b7_0>Badr<b7_0/><a2_0/> regained their freedom after they had taught some of the Muslims the simple writing of the time. Thus a group of Muslims gradually became literate. As it was initially spoken, the Quran was recorded on tablets, bones, and the wide, flat ends of <a3_0><b8_0>date palm<b8_0/><a3_0/> fronds. Most suras were in use amongst early Muslims since they are mentioned in numerous sayings by both Sunni and Shia sources, relating Muhammad's use of the Quran as a call to Islam, the making of prayer and the manner of recitation. However, the <a4_0><b9_0>Quran<b9_0/><a4_0/> did not exist in book form at the time of Muhammad's death in 632. There is agreement among scholars that Muhammad himself did not write down the revelation.
